message_1: How many stereoisomers are possible for a compound with the molecular formula C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>9</sub>Br if it contains one chiral carbon atom?
message_2: If a compound contains one chiral carbon atom, it can have two possible stereoisomers: one R-configuration and one S-configuration. These two stereoisomers are enantiomers of each other. So, for a compound with the molecular formula C4H9Br and one chiral carbon atom, there are 2 possible stereoisomers.
